describe: Canada is the second-largest country in the world by land area, known for its vast wilderness, multicultural cities, and friendly people. It is a country of immense natural beauty, from the Rocky Mountains to the Arctic tundra.

cities.name: üèù Toronto
cities.geographical_location: Located in Southern Ontario on the northwestern shore of Lake Ontario.
cities.climate: Toronto has a humid continental climate with warm summers and cold winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Peameal bacon sandwiches, butter tarts, and poutine.

cities.name: üèù Vancouver
cities.geographical_location: Situated on the west coast of British Columbia, bordered by the Pacific Ocean.
cities.climate: Vancouver has an oceanic climate with mild, rainy winters and warm, dry summers.
cities.famous_cuisine: Sushi, salmon dishes, and Dungeness crab.

cities.name: üèù Montreal
cities.geographical_location: Located in the province of Quebec, on the Island of Montreal at the confluence of the Saint Lawrence and Ottawa Rivers.
cities.climate: Montreal has a humid continental climate with warm summers and cold, snowy winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Poutine, bagels, and smoked meat sandwiches.

cities.name: üèî Calgary
cities.geographical_location: Located in the province of Alberta, near the foothills of the Canadian Rockies.
cities.climate: Calgary has a semi-arid climate with cold, dry winters and warm summers.
cities.famous_cuisine: Alberta beef, bison burgers, and ginger beef.

cities.name: üèù Halifax
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the province of Nova Scotia, on the eastern coast of Canada.
cities.climate: Halifax has a humid continental climate with mild summers and cold, snowy winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Lobster rolls, donairs, and seafood chowder.
